content:
SqlBinary Struct

Definition

Represents a variable-length stream of binary data to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

In this Article

[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProvider("GetXsdType")]
public struct SqlBinary : IComparable, System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
SqlBinary

Constructors

SqlBinary(Byte[])

Initializes a new instance of the SqlBinary structure, setting the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property to the contents of the supplied byte array.

public SqlBinary (byte[] value);
Parameters
value
Byte[]

The byte array to be stored or retrieved.

Fields

Null

Represents a DBNull that can be assigned to this instance of the SqlBinary structure.

public static readonly System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary Null;

Remarks

Null functions as a constant for the SqlBinary structure. For more information, see Handling Null Values.

Properties

IsNull

Indicates whether this SqlBinary structure is null. This property is read-only.

public bool IsNull { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if null; otherwise, false.

Remarks

For more information, see Handling Null Values.

Item(Int32)

Gets the single byte from the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property located at the position indicated by the integer parameter, index. If index indicates a position beyond the end of the byte array, a SqlNullValueException will be raised. This property is read-only.

public byte this[int index] { get; }
Parameters
index
Int32

The position of the byte to be retrieved.

Value
Byte

The byte located at the position indicated by the integer parameter.

Exceptions
SqlNullValueException

The property is read when the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property contains Null

- or -

The index parameter indicates a position byond the length of the byte array as indicated by the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Length* property.

Remarks

To avoid raising a SqlNullValueException, always examine the IsNull property and the Length property before reading this property.

Length

Gets the length in bytes of the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property. This property is read-only.

public int Length { get; }
Value
Int32

The length of the binary data in the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property.

Exceptions
SqlNullValueException

The Length property is read when the stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary.Value* property contains Null.

Remarks

To avoid raising a SqlNullValueException, always examine the IsNull property before reading the Length property.

Value

Gets the value of the SqlBinary structure. This property is read-only.

public byte[] Value { get; }
Value
Byte[]

The value of the SqlBinary structure.

Exceptions
SqlNullValueException

The Value property is read when the property contains Null.

Remarks

To avoid raising a SqlNullValueException, always examine the IsNull property before reading the Value property.

Methods

Add(SqlBinary, SqlBinary)

Concatenates two specified SqlBinary values to create a new SqlBinary structure.

public static System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary Add (System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary x, System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary y);
Parameters
x
SqlBinary

A SqlBinary.

y
SqlBinary

A SqlBinary.

Returns
SqlBinary

A SqlBinary that is the concatenated value of x and y.

Remarks

x will appear first in the resulting SqlBinary, followed by y.

CompareTo(SqlBinary)

Compares this SqlBinary object to the supplied SqlBinary object and returns an indication of their relative values.

public int CompareTo (System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary value);
Parameters
value
SqlBinary

The SqlBinary object to be compared to this SqlBinary structure.

Returns
Int32

A signed number that indicates the relative values of this SqlBinary structure and the object.

Return value
 Condition
Less than zero
 The value of this SqlBinary object is less than the object.
Zero
 This SqlBinary object is the same as object.
Greater than zero
 This SqlBinary object is greater than object.
-or-
The object is a null reference.
